info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 6:45PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in North Carolina... Broad River In NC At Boiling Springs affecting Cleveland County. .Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall will produce minor flooding along the Broad River channel tonight through Wednesday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Broad River In NC at Boiling Springs. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Action Stage. The Broad River is beginning to flood residential yards located off of Abe`s Mountain Rd. At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Broad River floodwaters may approach the base of residential home foundations between Abe`s Mountain Rd. and the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 845 AM EST.
